panels.description:
Errors are all requests with a status code of:
4xx and 5xx, except 401.
panels.title: Errors/sec

targets.expr:
sum(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_sum{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))
/
sum(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_count{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

panels.description: This is the reported cpu load in percent as average over all apaches.
panels.title: CPU Load

panels.description:
Errors are all requests with a status code of:
4xx and 5xx, except 401.
panels.title: Errors/sec

panels.description: The network IO is calculated from the response size. That's why there is no counter for "In".
panels.title: Bandwidth by vhost

targets.expr:
sum(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_sum{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))
/
sum(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_count{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

sum(rate(apache_response_size_bytes_sum{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))
/
sum(rate(apache_response_size_bytes_count{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

sum by(method, status)(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_sum{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))
/
sum by(method, status)(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_count{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

sum by(method, status)(rate(apache_response_size_bytes_sum{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))/sum by(method, status)(rate(apache_response_size_bytes_count{instance=~"$host", status=~"$status", method=~"$method", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

panels.description:
Each request is put into a predefined bucket matching its response time.
So this graph gives an overview over the distribution of response times.

targets.expr: sum by (le)(rate(apache_response_time_seconds_bucket{instance=~"$host", method=~"$method", status=~"$status", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

panels.title: Response Time Heatmap

panels.description:
Each request is put into a predefined bucket matching its response size.
So this graph gives an overview over the distribution of response sizes.

targets.expr: sum by (le)(rate(apache_response_size_bytes_bucket{instance=~"$host", method=~"$method", status=~"$status", vhost=~"$vhost", path=~"$path"}[1m]))

panels.title: Response Size Heatmap

panels.description: This graph only shows something useful if your exporter returns a 'path' label.
panels.title: Requests/sec By Path Label

panels.description:
Total sum of used memory over all apache processes.

RSS: resident memory (resident set size)
VMS: virtual memory (virtual memory size)
panels.title: Total Memory

panels.description: The network IO is calculated from the response size. That's why there is no counter for "In".
panels.title: Total Network IO
